comment: Added a sentence about the Bhagavad Gita (love and selflessness); just before this edit reworded the first paragraph to balance ideas and syntax.

diff.*:
Line 79: Line 79:      
[[Mary Baker Eddy]], the founder of [[Christian Science]], defines Love as one of 7 synonyms for God. This indicates that Diety is more than a being that has benevolent concerns for mankind, but rather that God is Love itself. Love is also synonymous with Principle, Mind, Soul, Spirit, Life, and Truth and indicate the depth and wholeness of Love.{{fact}}
 
[[Mary Baker Eddy]], the founder of [[Christian Science]], defines Love as one of 7 synonyms for God. This indicates that Diety is more than a being that has benevolent concerns for mankind, but rather that God is Love itself. Love is also synonymous with Principle, Mind, Soul, Spirit, Life, and Truth and indicate the depth and wholeness of Love.{{fact}}
  +   +
The [[Bhagavad Gita]], India's ageless Hindu scripture, helps devotees to see that love conquers all. It says, "Sattva—pure, luminous, and free from sorrow—binds us to happiness and wisdom" (Number 6). [[Sattva]], translated as purity, helps one to see that love evolves from selflessness.
